page.title: 01WELCOME TO BLACKROD
page.content: {Blackrod}is a quiet little village. It is surrounded by beautiful views of hills and fields. Many new people have come to live in Blackrod,as new houses are built,because of the rural setting and its closeness to the motorway and the relative cheapness of the property. Blackrod is an old village with an Anglo-Saxon name. It means a black or bleak clearing in a forest. There are still several attractive old buildings here.{Bobbin Hall}got its name because a master spinner lived there and at the side is a row of terraced cottages he owned. There was a passage from the hall through the cottages so the master could walk through to collect the bobbins of cotton his workers spun.{Pool Green}is a row of cottages behind what remains of the old village green.
